intro: Glottiphyllum obliquum, commonly known as the zigzag plant, is a member of the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it thrives in rocky and sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its unique, zigzagging stems that help it withstand harsh environmental conditions. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, often with a bluish-green hue. It produces small, tubular flowers that are typically white or pale blue, blooming in late summer.
